ygData.subject: Re: fluent coupling: c-c++ linking
ygData.msgSnippet: Dear all, dear Dave, I finally succeeded in coupling Cantera and Fluent, even if I made fluent simply call an independent Cantera using function

Dear all, dear Dave,
I finally succeeded in coupling Cantera and Fluent, even if I made 
fluent simply call an independent "Cantera using function" 
libhello.cpp.
The problem lied on the linker, so I used g++ instead of ld;
I attach here the most important parts of my src/makefile:

#---------------------------------------------------------------------
-#
# User modifiable section.
#---------------------------------------------------------------------
-#
SOURCES= call.c
FLUENT_INC= /usr/local/Fluent.Inc
#location of non-fluent libraries
LIB_DIR = /usr/local/lib/cantera
#c++ sources
CXX_SOURCES = libhello.cpp
MY_LIB = -L$(LIB_DIR) -loneD -lzeroD -ltransport -lconverters \
         -lcantera -lrecipes -lcvode -lctlapack -lctmath -lctblas \
	 -lctcxx  -L/usr/lib/gcc-lib/i386-redhat-linux/3.2\
	 -L/usr/lib/gcc-lib/i386-redhat-linux/3.2/../../.. \
	 -lfrtbegin -lg2c -lm -lgcc_s \
                  -lm
CXX= g++
CXX_INCLUDES = -I/usr/local/include/cantera
............................................
OBJECTS= $(UDFDATA:.c=.o) $(SOURCES:.c=.o) $(CXX_SOURCES:.cpp=.o) 
............................................
CFLAGS_LNX86=		-fPIC -ansi -Wall -O
............................................
.c.o:
	@echo "# Compiling $@ because of $?"
	@rm -f $*.o
	$(CC) $(CFLAGS) $(INCLUDES) -c $*.c
.cpp.o:
	$(CXX) -fPIC -Wall -g -c $< $(CXX_INCLUDES) 
............................................
$(TARGET): makefile $(UDFDATA) $(OBJECTS)
	@echo "# Linking $@ because of $?"
	$(CXX) -g -shared  -Wl,-soname,$@.0 -o $@.0.0 $(OBJECTS) 
(continues the preceding line) $(MY_LIB) -lc
	/sbin/ldconfig -n .
	ln -sf $@.0 $@


....and it seems to work ....
Thank you all very much again. Vincenzo.
